title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement sam.abbott@lshtm.ac.uk. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Model definition and implementation
text: model implemented stan using cmdstanr defaults altered[1,2]. epict incorporates additional functionality written R[3] enable plotting cycle threshold posterior predictions, summarising population-level cycle thresolhs, summarsing covariate effects. functionality modular allowing users extend alter underlying model whilst continuing use package framework.

what: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — adjustment_formula
title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — adjustment_formula
text: Specify cycle threshold adjustment model formula

title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — adjustment_formula
Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — adjustment_formula
text: formula model formula defaulting ~1. obs data.frame following variables: id: integer vector uniquely identifying eahc infection. test_id: integer vector uniquely identiying test ct_value: Numeric cycle threshold value. t: Relative (baseline) time test yielding Ct value. t_rel_uncensored: Time test relative first uncensored Ct value id. onset_t: Relative (baseline) time onset infection onset_t_rel_uncensored: Time onset relative first uncensored Ct value id. (optional). NA unavailable/asymptomatic. censored: Logical, indicating Ct censored. beta_default vector length two containing default mean standard deviation use prior covariate effect sizes.

title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — adjustment_formula
text: named list including design matrix ("design") data.table priors covariate effects ("beta").

title: epict: Flexible Cycle Threshold Modelling — epict-package
text: Maintainer: Sam Abbott sam.abbott@lshtm.ac.uk (ORCID) Authors: Tim Russell timothy.russell@lshtm.ac.uk Joel Hellewell joel.hellewell@lshtm.ac.uk

title: Model Cycle Thresholds — epict
text: Provides user friendly interface around package functionality model cycle thresholds, symptom onsets observed preprocessed data, piecewise linear model, linear adjustment model.

title: Model Cycle Thresholds — epict
code: epict(   obs,   model = epict_model(),   piecewise_formula = epict::piecewise_formula(~1, obs),   adjustment_formula = epict::adjustment_formula(~1, obs),   priors = epict::epict_priors(),   model_opts = epict::epict_model_opts(),   inference_opts = epict::epict_inference_opts(),   convert_to_list = epict_convert_to_list,   inits = epict_inits,   ... )

title: Model Cycle Thresholds — epict
text: obs data.frame following variables: id: integer vector uniquely identifying eahc infection. test_id: integer vector uniquely identiying test ct_value: Numeric cycle threshold value. t: Relative (baseline) time test yielding Ct value. t_rel_uncensored: Time test relative first uncensored Ct value id. onset_t: Relative (baseline) time onset infection onset_t_rel_uncensored: Time onset relative first uncensored Ct value id. (optional). NA unavailable/asymptomatic. censored: Logical, indicating Ct censored. piecewise_formula list describing piecewise linear cycle threshold formula described piecewise_formula(). adjustment_formula list describing cycle threshold linear adjustment formula (shift scale) described adjustment_formula(). priors data.table population-level priors produced epict_priors(). model_opts list Cycle threshold model options returned epict_ct_model_opts(). convert_to_list Convert observations model settings list use stan. Defaults using epict_convert_to_list(). inits function combined list data returns sample initial conditions use model fitting based model priors. Defaults epict_inits() ... Additional arguments passed cmdstanr.

title: Model Cycle Thresholds — epict
text: cmdstanr model fit containing posterior samples

title: Check unproccessed observations meet the package specification — epict_check_raw_obs
Check unproccessed observations meet the package specification — epict_check_raw_obs
text: obs data.frame following variables: id: integer vector uniquely identifying infection. test_id: integer vector uniquely identiying test ct_value: Numeric cycle threshold value. test_date: Date test yielding Ct value. (optional) t: Time test relative baseline date. Optional required test_date present. onset_date:e Date onset infection (optional). NA unavailable/asymptomatic onset_t: Time onset relative baseline date (optional). censored: Logical, indicating Ct censored. dates_available Logical, defaults TRUE. dates available observed data. FALSE assumed relative times available instead. check_onset Logical, defaults FALSE. observations checked presence symptom onset data.

title: Clean up factor levels — epict_clean_factors
Clean up factor levels — epict_clean_factors
text: vars character vector variables. Defaults empty.

title: Clean up factor levels — epict_clean_factors
text: data.table empty factors dropped character vectors transformed factors specified.

title: Clean up factor levels — epict_clean_factors
text: Sam Abbott

title: Clean up factor levels — epict_clean_factors
code: obs <- data.frame(  m = c("fa", "aefwe", "efe"),  c = as.factor(c("fa", "asas", "asa")) ) summary(obs) #>       m                c     #>  Length:3           asa :1   #>  Class :character   asas:1   #>  Mode  :character   fa  :1    # Default without specifying variables summary(epict_clean_factors(obs)) #>       m                c     #>  Length:3           asa :1   #>  Class :character   asas:1   #>  Mode  :character   fa  :1    # Specify variables summary(epict_clean_factors(obs, vars = c("m", "c"))) #>      m        c     #>  aefwe:1   asa :1   #>  efe  :1   asas:1   #>  fa   :1   fa  :1

what: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
title: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
text: Filter infection IDs based characteristics

title: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
code: epict_filter_ids(   obs,   min_uncensored_tests = 2,   min_days_with_uncensored = 2,   invert = FALSE )

title: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
text: obs data.frame following variables: id: integer vector uniquely identifying infection. t: Time test relative baseline date. censored: Logical, indicating Ct censored. min_uncensored_tests Numeric defaults 2. minimum number uncensored tests ID must order included processed dataset. min_days_with_uncensored Numeric defaults 2. minimum number days tests per ID must span order included processed dataset. invert Logical, defaults FALSE. filtering requirements inverted. switches exluding including can used debugging data exploration.

title: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
text: data.table IDs failing/meeting specified criteria removed

title: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
text: Sam Abbott

title: Filter infection IDs based on characteristics — epict_filter_ids
code: obs <- data.frame(  censored = c(TRUE, rep(FALSE, 3), TRUE, rep(FALSE, 4)),  id = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4), t = c(0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1) )  # Use defaults epict_filter_ids(obs) #>    censored id t uncensored_tests days_with_uncensored #> 1:     TRUE  1 0                2                    2 #> 2:    FALSE  1 0                2                    2 #> 3:    FALSE  1 1                2                    2  # Invert with defaults epict_filter_ids(obs, invert = TRUE) #>    censored id t uncensored_tests days_with_uncensored #> 1:    FALSE  2 1                1                    1 #> 2:     TRUE  3 1                1                    1 #> 3:    FALSE  3 2                1                    1  # Remove IDs with less than 3 tests epict_filter_ids(obs, min_uncensored_tests = 3, min_days_with_uncensored = 1) #>    censored id t uncensored_tests days_with_uncensored #> 1:    FALSE  4 1                3                    1 #> 2:    FALSE  4 1                3                    1 #> 3:    FALSE  4 1                3                    1  #' # Remove IDs with less than 3 tests - this will be all available data epict_filter_ids(obs, min_days_with_uncensored = 3) #> Empty data.table (0 rows and 5 cols): censored,id,t,uncensored_tests,days_with_uncensored

title: Flag potentially spurious observations — epict_flag_spurious_obs
text: Flag potentially spurious observations

title: Flag potentially spurious observations — epict_flag_spurious_obs
code: epict_flag_spurious_obs(   obs,   max_t_rel_uncensored = 60,   max_onset_t_rel_uncensored = 15,   flag = TRUE,   drop = TRUE,   return_spurious = FALSE )

title: Flag potentially spurious observations — epict_flag_spurious_obs
text: obs data.frame following variables: t_rel_uncensored: Time test relative first uncensored Ct value id. onset_t_rel_uncensored: Time onset relative first uncensored Ct value id. (optional). NA unavailable/asymptomatic. max_t_rel_uncensored Numeric defaults 60 days. Flags maximum absolute relative time considered plausible tests spaced per ID. max_onset_t_rel_uncensored Numeric defaults 15 days. Flags maximum absolute relative time considered plausible symptom onset first uncensored test per ID. flag Logical, defaults TRUE. spurious tests flagged drop Logical, defaults TRUE. spurious tests onsets dropped (set NA onsets filtered tests). return_spurious Logical, defaults FALSE. Rather returning observations observations flagged spurious returned.

title: Flag potentially spurious observations — epict_flag_spurious_obs
text: data.table observations

title: Flag potentially spurious observations — epict_flag_spurious_obs
text: Sam Abbott

title: Flag potentially spurious observations — epict_flag_spurious_obs
code: obs <- data.frame(t_rel_uncensored = c(0, 2, 10, 60, 100, 30))  # Run with defaults fil_obs <- epict_flag_spurious_obs(obs) #> The following tests have been identified as having spurious data #>    t_rel_uncensored #> 1:              100 #> Spurious tests have been dropped fil_obs #>    t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                0 #> 2:                2 #> 3:               10 #> 4:               60 #> 5:               30 epict_flag_spurious_obs(fil_obs) #>    t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                0 #> 2:                2 #> 3:               10 #> 4:               60 #> 5:               30  # Add onsets and repeat obs$onset_t_rel_uncensored <- c(0, 15, 2, NA, 40, 5) fil_obs <- epict_flag_spurious_obs(obs) #> The following tests have been identified as having spurious data #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:              100                     40 #> 2:                2                     15 #> Spurious tests have been dropped fil_obs #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                0                      0 #> 2:                2                     NA #> 3:               10                      2 #> 4:               60                     NA #> 5:               30                      5 epict_flag_spurious_obs(fil_obs) #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                0                      0 #> 2:                2                     NA #> 3:               10                      2 #> 4:               60                     NA #> 5:               30                      5  # Return spurious observations epict_flag_spurious_obs(obs, return_spurious = TRUE) #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:              100                     40 #> 2:                2                     15  # Flag spurious results but don't drop epict_flag_spurious_obs(obs, drop = FALSE) #> The following tests have been identified as having spurious data #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:              100                     40 #> 2:                2                     15 #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                0                      0 #> 2:                2                     15 #> 3:               10                      2 #> 4:               60                     NA #> 5:              100                     40 #> 6:               30                      5  # Siltently drop epict_flag_spurious_obs(obs, flag = FALSE) #> Spurious tests have been dropped #>    t_rel_uncensored onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                0                      0 #> 2:                2                     NA #> 3:               10                      2 #> 4:               60                     NA #> 5:               30                      5

title: Make time relative to first date of the test. — epict_make_time_rel
text: data.table t variable containing numeric time days since baseline_date.

title: Make time relative to first date of the test. — epict_make_time_rel
text: Sam Abbott

title: Make time relative to first date of the test. — epict_make_time_rel
code: obs <- data.frame(test_date = as.Date(c("2022-04-22", "2022-04-19")))  # Using default baseline date epict_make_time_rel(obs) #>     test_date t #> 1: 2022-04-22 3 #> 2: 2022-04-19 0  # Using user specified baseline date epict_make_time_rel(obs, baseline_date = as.Date("2022-04-01")) #>     test_date  t #> 1: 2022-04-22 21 #> 2: 2022-04-19 18  # When onsets are present obs$onset_date <- obs$test_date epict_make_time_rel(obs) #>     test_date onset_date t onset_t #> 1: 2022-04-22 2022-04-22 3       3 #> 2: 2022-04-19 2022-04-19 0       0

code: obs <- data.frame(  id = c(rep(1, 3), rep(2, 4)), t = c(2, 3, 4, 1, 1, 2, 8),   onset_t = c(rep(2, 3), rep(4, 4)),  censored = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, rep(FALSE, 3)) )  epict_make_time_rel_to_first_uncensored(obs) #>    id t onset_t censored t_first_uncensored t_rel_uncensored #> 1:  1 2       2     TRUE                  3               -1 #> 2:  1 3       2    FALSE                  3                0 #> 3:  1 4       2    FALSE                  3                1 #> 4:  2 1       4     TRUE                  1                0 #> 5:  2 1       4    FALSE                  1                0 #> 6:  2 2       4    FALSE                  1                1 #> 7:  2 8       4    FALSE                  1                7 #>    onset_t_rel_uncensored #> 1:                     -1 #> 2:                     -1 #> 3:                     -1 #> 4:                      3 #> 5:                      3 #> 6:                      3 #> 7:                      3

what: Load and compile the Cycle thresholds model — epict_model
title: Load and compile the Cycle thresholds model — epict_model
text: Load compile Cycle thresholds model

title: Load and compile the Cycle thresholds model — epict_model
code: epict_model(   model,   include,   compile = TRUE,   threads = FALSE,   stanc_options = list("O1"),   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Load and compile the Cycle thresholds model — epict_model
text: model character string indicating path model. supplied package default model used. include character string specifying path stan files include model. missing package default used. compile Logical, defaults TRUE. model loaded compiled using cmdstanr::cmdstan_model(). threads Logical, defaults FALSE. model compile support multi-thread support chain. Note requires use threads_per_chain argument model fitting using epict() currently supported model. stanc_options list options pass stanc_options cmdstanr::cmdstan_model(). default "01" passed specifies simple optimisations done prior compilation. verbose Logical, defaults TRUE. verbose messages shown. ... Additional arguments passed cmdstanr::cmdstan_model().

title: Format formula data for use with stan — epict_model_opts
code: epict_model_opts(   onsets = TRUE,   switch = FALSE,   latent_infections = TRUE,   variation = "correlated" )

title: Format formula data for use with stan — epict_model_opts
text: switch Logical, default FALSE. secondary breakpoint included piecewise linear Cycle threshold model. latent_infections Logical, defaults TRUE. latent time infection modelled used adjust time first positive test. variation character string indicating type individual level variation include. Defaults "correlated" (random effect modelled correlation structure). options include "uncorrelated" ( random effect modelled correlation structure), "none" (individual level variation).

title: Default model priors — epict_priors
code: epict_priors() #>     variable                                           name #>  1:    t_inf Time between infection and first positive test #>  2:    c_int                          Latent upper Ct bound #>  3:      c_p                                        Peak Ct #>  4:      t_p                                Time at peak Ct #>  5:      c_s                                      Switch Ct #>  6:      t_s                              Time at switch Ct #>  7:  t_clear                 Time at clearance of infection #>  8: inc_mean                  Mean of the incubation period #>  9:   inc_sd    Standard deviation of the incubation period #> 10:    sigma                 Observation standard deviation #> 11:      lkj         Lewandowski-Kurowicka-Joe distribution #>                                                                                                                                                                                                               detail #>  1:                                                                                                                                                                                     Offset by onset if available #>  2:                                                                                                                                                                   Offset by user specified limit of Ct detection #>  3:                                                                                                                                                     Logit scale offset by latent limit of detection/Ct at switch #>  4:                                                                                                                                                                                                        Log scale #>  5:                                                                                                                                                                  Logit scale offset by latent limit of detection #>  6:                                                                                                                                                                        Log scale relative to the time at peak Ct #>  7:                                                                                                                                                                            Relative to time at peak and switch C #>  8:                                                                                                                                                                       Parameterised as a log-normal distribution #>  9:                                                                                                                                                                       Parameterised as a log-normal distribution #> 10:                                                                                                                                                                                    Assuming a normal error model #> 11: Prior used for the individual-level correlation matrix. There is \n      one parameter which at 1 represents a uniform prior. Smaller values indicate strong correlations, and larger values weaker correlations #>                                                distribution intercept_mean #>  1:                        Normal (truncated by onset or 0)           5.00 #>  2: Normal (truncated by user specified limit of detection)          10.00 #>  3:                                                  Normal           0.00 #>  4:                                                  Normal           1.61 #>  5:                                                  Normal           0.00 #>  6:                                                  Normal           1.61 #>  7:                                                  Normal           2.30 #>  8:                                                  Normal           1.62 #>  9:                                   Zero truncated normal           0.42 #> 10:                                   Zero truncated normal           2.00 #> 11:            Lewandowski-Kurowicka-Joe (LKJ) distribution           1.00 #>     intercept_sd individual_variation_mean individual_variation_sd #>  1:         5.00                         0                    0.05 #>  2:        10.00                        NA                      NA #>  3:         1.00                         0                    0.05 #>  4:         0.50                         0                    0.05 #>  5:         1.00                         0                    0.05 #>  6:         0.50                         0                    0.05 #>  7:         0.50                         0                    0.05 #>  8:         0.06                         0                    0.05 #>  9:         0.07                         0                    0.05 #> 10:         2.00                        NA                      NA #> 11:           NA                        NA                      NA

what: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — piecewise_formula
title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — piecewise_formula
text: Specify cycle threshold adjustment model formula

title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — piecewise_formula
Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — piecewise_formula
text: formula model formula defaulting ~1. obs data.frame following variables: id: integer vector uniquely identifying eahc infection. test_id: integer vector uniquely identiying test ct_value: Numeric cycle threshold value. t: Relative (baseline) time test yielding Ct value. t_rel_uncensored: Time test relative first uncensored Ct value id. onset_t: Relative (baseline) time onset infection onset_t_rel_uncensored: Time onset relative first uncensored Ct value id. (optional). NA unavailable/asymptomatic. censored: Logical, indicating Ct censored. beta_default vector length two containing default mean standard deviation use prior covariate effect sizes. params character string indicating paramters adjust piecewise model. Defaults "". Options : time peak ("t_p"), time switch ("t_p"), time clearance ("t_clear"), Cycle threshold (Ct) peak ("c_p"), Ct switch ("c_s"), incubation period mean ("inc_mean"), incubation period standard deviation ("inc_sd").

title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — piecewise_formula
text: named list including design matrix ("design") data.table priors covariate effects ("beta").

title: Specify the cycle threshold adjustment model formula — piecewise_formula
text: Sam Abbott
